messages.subject: Re: Moving to Spokane, WA area
messages.msgSnippet: Thank you everyone who responded!  I ll definitely check out the links. Yes, Ren, we will be coming back to the states - hopefully a couple of months earlier
messages.messageBody:
Thank you everyone who responded! I'll definitely check out the
links.

Yes, Ren, we will be coming back to the states - hopefully a couple
of months earlier than we anticipated. We are so ready. Dh has
also been gone for 3 months already - deployed to Qatar - and he has
one month to go yet. So he's missing all of our family birthdays as
well as all the good holidays :( We've been lonely lately.

We think that we would eventually like to buy land in the NW too,
but we aren't in a position to do that just yet. Maybe after we
live there for a few years.

Thanks all of you with good wishes, and we may try to stay "under
the radar" too - not sure yet.

-Christy

messages.subject: Re: Moving to Spokane, WA area
messages.msgSnippet: You might check out http://groups.yahoo.com/group/wash It s a yahoo group for Washington state homeschoolers/unschoolers, etc. (It s not strictly unschooling -
messages.messageBody:
You might check out http://groups.yahoo.com/group/wash
It's a yahoo group for Washington state homeschoolers/unschoolers,
etc. (It's not strictly unschooling - the include homeschoolers,
eclectic, unschoolers, etc.). Most of the people seem to be based on
the West side of the state, but I know there are a couple of people
who post there who live in Eastern Washington.

Good luck and welcome to the Pacific NW!

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Moving to Spokane, WA area
messages.msgSnippet: Welcome to Washington!  I live CLEAR on the other side of the state, in Bellingham, but hubby and I went to college in Spokane, and we drive through now and
messages.messageBody:
Welcome to Washington! I live CLEAR on the other side
of the state, in Bellingham, but hubby and I went to
college in Spokane, and we drive through now and then.


Sorry, I have no advice for homeschooling laws--we
just moved back to Washington and we are "under the
radar" as I don't want to have to deal with it ;)

But good to have more unschoolers moving into the
state!

Dana

messages.msgSnippet: Christy, I don t have any advice for you, but I have a friend who recently moved to that area, and she says it s absolutely beautiful up there! I hope you
messages.messageBody:
Christy,

I don't have any advice for you, but I have a friend
who recently moved to that area, and she says it's
absolutely beautiful up there! I hope you enjoy
it...my friend is!

Elizabeth

messages.subject: Moving to Spokane, WA area
messages.msgSnippet: We just found out that we will be moving to the Spokane area in the spring sometime - to Fairchild AFB. You re coming back to the U.S.?!! YAY!! I know it s
messages.messageBody:
"We just found out that we will be moving to the Spokane area in the
spring sometime - to Fairchild AFB."


You're coming back to the U.S.?!! YAY!!
I know it's not Spokane, but Markus and I are looking at buying some
property up North for a summer getaway. We've most recently been
looking at the SE corner of Idaho, figuring we'd be on I-84 and have
a straight shot to Portland for seeing family.

WA laws weren't too bad when we were there. I'll let some WA folks
give you details though, it's been a few years for us.

Ren

messages.subject: Re: Moving to Spokane, WA area
messages.msgSnippet: ... Hi Christy, We ll be moving to some Air Force Base next summer (from Andrews), but still no idea which one. Hope you like it at Fairchild! --aj

>

> here a lot and have been reading at unschooling.com for several
> years now.
>
> We just found out that we will be moving to the Spokane area in the
> spring sometime - to Fairchild AFB.

Hi Christy,

We'll be moving to some Air Force Base next summer (from Andrews),
but still no idea which one.

Hope you like it at Fairchild!

--aj

messages.subject: Moving to Spokane, WA area
messages.msgSnippet: Hi all.  I never post here, so you all don t know me, but I do read here a lot and have been reading at unschooling.com for several years now. We just found
messages.messageBody:
Hi all. I never post here, so you all don't know me, but I do read
here a lot and have been reading at unschooling.com for several
years now.

We just found out that we will be moving to the Spokane area in the
spring sometime - to Fairchild AFB. We would so love to meet some
unschoolers because it's been a long time since we had anyone to
hang out with/play with. We have 2 daughters - one will be 10 and
the other 5 years old.

Is anyone in the Spokane area? Does anyone have any advice about
unschooling in Washington? I would love to hear from anyone!
Thanks.

-Christy
